Dating: 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not before); TAHARQA/KHUNEFERTEMRE ?; 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not after)
Name: Ram head
Description: These two pieces of faience come from the temple of Taharqa at Kawa. They represent the heads of rams dressed with solar disks and two Kushite uraei. Symbolising the god Amun-Re, the pieces served as decorative elements.
